intro: Mohrodendron, commonly known as the golden mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer to early fall. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture. Mohrodendron thrives in full sun to partial shade and is often found in moist, well-drained soils.
